text.__SUMMARY__: Shorea virescens is a species of plant in the Dipterocarpaceae family. The inference of the species name, derived from Latin (virescens = becoming green), is unclear. This species occurs in Borneo and the Philippines.
text.Description: It is an emergent tree, up to 50 metres (160 ft) tall, in mixed dipterocarp forest on clay soils.Shorea virescens is found in at least two protected areas (Lambir & Gunung Mulu National Parks), but is threatened elsewhere due to habitat loss.
text.Wood:
It is a light hardwood sold under the trade names of White Meranti.
